is an island just next to the famous Blue Lagoon and Turtle Island in the

- Go for a walk over the island. You can see the native cassava gardens, great views of the other islands and the Blue Lagoon, as well as get a sense of the difference between the windward and the leeward sides of the island. Take water with you, it can get hot.

- Go snokeling in the Blue Lagoon. It has been declared a fish sanctuary and has great fish and some great coral. If you are lucky you can spot sea-horses in the grass, extremely rare fish, or a sea snake (obviously give the snake it's space).

- Go scuba diving (and/or get certified). The Dive shop on Nanuya serves most of the upper the Yasawa chain. The instructors are both extremely knowledgeable and great people. There is also a vast array of great dives just a short boat ride away. The rental gear is also well-maintained and reasonably priced.

value: content=Fantastic people, gourmet food, great accommodations and beautiful beaches.
content=A resort with large plate dinners and cold, sea-water showers. The coral and fish viewing are poor.
